p: The RING-between-RING (RBR) E3 ubiquitin protein ligase parkin, which is involved in the induction of mitophagy, has recently emerged as another important mitochondria-associated modulator of innate immune function ( Manzanillo et al., 2013). It has been shown that hepatitis B virus modulates parkin function for immune evasion by recruitment of the linear ubiquitin assembly complex (LUBAC) to mitochondria to disrupt MAVS downstream signaling ( Khan et al., 2016).
